page.title: 06Petworth Old People's Homes
page.content: Courtlea near the Medical Centre, which is one of the home was built in 1973. They have 36 rooms and 3 floors. Also they a lift in case they can't walk up and down the stairs. There are 21 ladies on the staff. The capacity of the home is 44 patients. Breakfast is at 8.45, dinner at 12.45 and tea at 5.00. The oldest person there is Mrs. Howick who is 100 next year. Lund House and Edmond House in Mant Road are both shelter houses (which means the people look after themselves). When they are in difficulty they ring a bell and someone comes and helps them.
